sanskrit_verse:
सवर्णाऽग्रे द्विजातीनां प्रशस्ता दारकर्मणि ।
कामतस्तु प्रवृत्तानामिमाः स्युः क्रमशोऽवराः ॥ ३.१२॥
transliteration:
savarnā'gre dvijātīnāṁ praśastā dārakarmaṇi |
kāmatastu pravṛttānāmimāḥ syuḥ kramaśo'varāḥ || 3.12||
sph_interpretive_translation: Among the twice-born, those of the same varna are first approved for the duties of householdership; those who act from desire are assigned successively lower roles.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derived from alignment with svadharma
Capacity-based responsibility determined by spiritual readiness
Consciousness alignment via structural societal harmony
executable_legal_axioms: IF actor.is_dvija() AND action.scope == 'householder_duty' THEN priority = varna_equality(actor, role)
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters concerning dharmic duty or social role fulfillment, the court must prioritize alignment with one's svadharma over punitive measures. The hierarchy of responsibility is determined not by birth alone but by conscious readiness and purity of intent.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that actions aligned with svadharma yield harmonious outcomes. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows how deviation due to desire leads to sequential descent in functional authority. Responsibility is proportional to awareness, not punishment. Reality enforces naturally through loss of capacity when dharma is violated.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Assign completion process for unmet responsibilities
Engage consciousness purification practices until readiness restored
Reintegrate individual into appropriate varna-role without shame or exclusion
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority. Dharma is restored through alignment, not punishment. Reality itself adjusts roles based on consciousness. There is no condemnation—only realignment toward truth.
